content.title: Development and Maintenance of Orchard Cum Horti Nurseries
content.details: The scheme “Development and Maintenance of Orchard Cum Horti Nurseries” was launched by the Department of Agriculture & Farmers’ Welfare, Government of Meghalaya for the production and multiplication of good, high-yielding, diseased free planting materials in the Government farms for distribution to farmers through District Horticulture Officer.
benefits: Training, awareness program, extension, technology support.
Production and multiplication of good, high-yielding, diseased free planting materials for sale.
Introduction of new high-yielding varieties of mother plants, suitable to the different areas of the State.
eligibility: The applicant should be a permanent resident of Meghalaya.
The applicant should be a bonafide farmer engaged in agriculture.
The applicant/farmer should own or lease land of at least 200 sq.ms.
content.application_process: Offline. The eligible bonafide farmer can apply/write an application on plain paper. Along with the application, attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required). Submit the duly filled and signed application along with the documents at your nearest office of the Horticulture Development Officer of a CD Block/Horticulture Circle.
documents_required: Documents proof of possessing own or leased land

faqs.question: What is the key objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: For production and multiplication of good, high yielding, diseased free planting materials in the Government farms for distribution to farmers through District Horticulture Officer.

faqs.question: Which department has launched this scheme?
faqs.answer: Department of Agriculture & Farmers’ Welfare, Government of Meghalaya.

faqs.question: What is the type of assistance/service?
faqs.answer: Production and multiplication of good, high yielding, diseased free planting materials for sale. Introduction of new high yielding varieties of mother plants, suitable to the different areas of the State.

faqs.question: What is the pattern of assistance?
faqs.answer: Training, awareness program, extension, technology support.

faqs.question: Who can apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: The bonafide farmers engaged in Agriculture, possessing own or leased land of at least 200sqms are eligible to apply under the scheme.

faqs.question: How to apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: The bonafide farmers can apply in plain paper through the nearest Horticulture Development Officer of a CD Block/ Horticulture Circle.

faqs.question: What is the beneficiaries’ selection procedure?
faqs.answer: Bonafide farmers on first come first serve basis.

faqs.question: Whom to contact?
faqs.answer: District Horticulture Officer and Horticulture Development Officer.
